page.title: 11THE CAMPO
page.content: Fen Ditton "Campo" probably got its name from its use by soldiers in the World War 1 for trench-digging training, which was the reason for its once very uneven surface. About 5 years ago the Campo was acquired by the Parish Council from Major Francis of Quy Hall for use as a recreation ground. It was then levelled over a period of two years and then seeded and left for further year. The new recreation ground is administered by a committee, of which Mr. Marson is a member. Cricket and footballing interests are represented. A pavilion is being built on the site by local voluntary labour. In 1981 Mr. Marson and Mr. Lovell formed the Fen Ditton Rangers boys gootball team. The team joined the "Colts" league and is in 1985 in second place in the league.
